body:
Ok some absolute reasoning in support of closing - this was an issue with iOS 5 - it appears Apple decided to cut some fields out of the ASN.1 encoding for their X509 pk's(1), they stopped doing this in iOS 6 onwards. iOS 5 possibly accounts for around < 1.4% of all iOS versions in the wild(2) so surely < 0.3% (3) of all mobile generated pks to hit servers. 

(1) - http://blog.wingsofhermes.org/?p=42
(2) - https://david-smith.org/iosversionstats/
(3) - my guesswork

(p.s. If you do get another report of this - can you put me in contact with the other party, because it must be an indication that the universe intended us to meet each other, in other words apologies for wasting your time (again))
